intro: Plesioneuron royenii, commonly known as the Royal fern, is a rare and unique species of fern native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive, elegant fronds that are often described as resembling the shape of a crown or a royal headdress. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its reproductive structures, including sporangia, are clustered in specialized clusters called sori, which are usually located on the underside of the fronds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Plesioneuron royenii is considered a conservation concern in many areas.
